instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board that had mild water damage. After replacing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and everything else that had corrosion I now get a green light and the board attempts to power on when pads are shorted but still no fan spin.

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is 0.871 V and cpu/gpu get warm without a heatsink.

Could this be a smc issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is pulsing, or steady 0.97V?

CPU/MCP get hot even without trying to power on?
That's no good at all.

F7040 voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is 0V when system off. When turning on its a steady 0.871V

CPU/MCP only get hot when turning the board on by shorting pads

F7040 12.60V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
So board turns on.
Do you get voltage at any big coil?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Nothing on L7220???

"L7260 5v"
Means <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> comes high.
So other voltages should be present; the ones controlled by that signal.
As DDR voltage, for example...

Also check if <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> is high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> 3.332v"
Means board is now in S0 state...

Please post voltage on ALL coils of the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
After closer inspection i didn't like the way <CHIP>U7500</CHIP> looked so replaced it.

I have fan spin now but its not booting up fully. When I turn it on the sleep light blinks once and nothing else happens. What can cause this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: please respond, what does the 1 blinking light mean with fast fan spin?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
"Please post voltage on ALL coils of the board."
Please respond...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Did you try only one module DDR3-8500 at a time, each slot?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: yes, when using the bottom slot the sleep light will blink once and when using top slot it will blink three times

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Does it beep RAM error if starts without any RAM module?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: without any ram installed the light will blink once every few seconds but no beeping sounds
